cyclone.name: KAY
cyclone.current_location: about 340 miles south of the southern tip of Baja California
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northwest and then north-northwest along and just west of the Baja California peninsula, likely remaining offshore while moving toward the northern Baja coast and the waters off southern California.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the west-central coast of the Baja California peninsula (around Punta Eugenia, Baja California Sur)

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of San Evaristo to Santa Rosalia and north of Cabo San Lazaro to Punta Abreojos (Baja California peninsula)
weather_observation.warning_coast: San Evaristo southward to Cabo San Lucas and Cabo San Lucas northward to Cabo San Lazaro (southern Baja California peninsula)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southwestern mainland Mexico, the southern and central Baja California peninsula, west-central Baja, and adjacent Pacific waters extending toward southern California
weather_observation.wind: Gusty southeast to east winds possible late Friday into Saturday with occasional gusts near tropical-storm force; overall likelihood low (≤5%).
weather_observation.storm_surge: Large swells, high surf, and dangerous rip currents expected; minor coastal flooding possible but surge heights below 3 ft.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of moderate to heavy rain could deliver 1–3 inches Friday night through Saturday, causing ponding on terminal surfaces.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and elevated wave heights in the harbor approaches may disrupt pilot boarding operations and container handling.
